page.title: 01PULBOROUGH, WEST SUSSEX.
page.content: Pulborough could be described either as a large village or a small town. It is situated on a low sandstone escarpment, overlooking the extensive flood plain of the River Arun, in the Weald. The site has always been one of importance, being at the crossroads of the main London to Chichester (A29) route and the Shoreham to Midhurst (A283) road. There is a railway station affording easy access to London and Portsmouth. Commercial river traffic ceased earlier this century, the tidal waters of the Arun now being used for leisure craft and fishing. Just south of the village is the confluence of the Western Rother with the Arun, and it is the former that supplies the village with water. Focal points are the 13th.century church, village hall and recreation ground.
